data.title: MSSC: Multi-Source Self-Calibration
data.name: multi_self_cal
data.description: Multi-Source Self-Calibration is a Parseltongue (Kettenis et al. 2012) script which provides an extra calibration for VLBI data sets that image multiple target source within one observation. More information is in the README & paper Radcliffe et. al 2016. If you use this script please reference Radcliffe et al. 2016 which is the paper that accompanies this release.

evidence: "Multi-Source Self-Calibration (MSSC) is a direction-dependent, calibration technique..." and is invoked as a script: `ParselTongue multi_source_self_cal.py MSSC_input.txt`, indicating an end-user analysis application.

The README describes a specific calibration technique for wide-field VLBI data sets, used to derive phase corrections, directly contributing to scientific data processing: "permitting self-calibration to become feasible".

Usage is shown only via running the script from source with ParselTongue: `ParselTongue multi_source_self_cal.py MSSC_input.txt`, with no mention of package managers, binaries, or containers, implying distribution via the source repository.
